greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n such that 2^n-1 has only one primitive prime factor, sorted according to the magnitude of the corresponding prime.
comment: Periods associated with A144755 in base 2. The binary analog of A051627.
example: 2^12 - 1 = 4095 = 3 * 3 * 5 * 7 * 13, but none of 3, 5, 7 is a primitive prime factor, so the only primitive prime factor of 2^12 - 1 is 13.
mathematica: nmax = 65536; primesPeriods = Reap[Do[p = Cyclotomic[n, 2]/GCD[n, Cyclotomic[n, 2]]; If[PrimeQ[p], Print[n]; Sow[{p, n}]], {n, 1, nmax}]][[2, 1]]; Sort[primesPeriods][[All, 2]]
results.author: _Eric Chen_, Nov 16 2014
